programme.title: Lion Warrior
programme.desc: This is the story of the survival of the Maasai-land lion. Under Africa's iconic Mt Kilimanjaro, lives one of the world's most romanticized tribes; the Maasai, who are in a real-time 'life and death' struggle with the world's most beloved big cat: the lion.

programme.title: Lion Dynasty
programme.desc: Our unique story spans a decade and follows one of Tanzania‚Äôs most powerful lion prides as they overcome mounting obstacles by relying on strong family bonds. With seven lionesses in their prime, 13 cubs between them, and two part-time magnificent males, the Bushbuck pride is large and in charge -- and determined to make sure that their legacy lives on. .

programme.title: Tree Climbing Lions
programme.desc: Big cat biologist Alexander Braczkowski is on a mission. He's got 90 days to count lions in Uganda and learn how the population is doing. But these aren't ordinary lions. The prides in Queen Elizabeth National Park spend most of their lives up in the trees, a rare and mysterious behavior unique to this part of Africa. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The clinic is slammed with summertime cases as the vets battle to save a badly injured cat, a farm dog with a puncture wound, and a wobbling mini horse struggling to walk. The team is seeing double as pairs of ferrets and chickens come through the door. Doc and Dianes new puppy brings chaos and cuteness to the clinic.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The Fair is in full swing! Getting to this day took months of hard work from vets and kids to get the Fair animals in tip top shape. Even after the Fair opens, the vets are on call to treat any emergency that pops up. Dr. Pol treats a goat with a torn ear as Dr. Lisa examines a limping cow. At the clinic, Dr. Nicole is tireless in her effort to save the life of a beloved dog.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Armed with a bucket and tube, Dr. Pol works tirelessly to help a horse struggling with choke. Inside the clinic, Dr. Lisa tackles the many maladies of Mushi the cat, and Dr. Brenda treats a fussy feline. Something odd happens when Doc meets another DocDr. Strange the steer. Charles is worried about his dog Athena and looks to his dad for guidance. .

The prides in Queen Elizabeth National Park spend most of their lives up in the trees, a rare and mysterious behavior unique to this part of Africa. .

programme.title: Secrets Of The Octopus
programme.desc: Octopuses break all the rules on animal intelligence. Born into the world as orphans, they are self-taught masterminds; capable of solving complex problems, strategizing, even planning for the future. Extraordinary superpowers that are the secret to their success.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Octopus
programme.desc: Octopuses were always thought to be natures ultimate loners, preferring their own company. The truth is they have secret social lives. From moms to be hanging out in the deep in their hundreds to an octopus capable of coworking with another species. These aliens of nature are more sociable than ever imagined.
